name: Hotel Sorrento City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant location and within walking distance from the train station and many restaurants and great views.
reviews.title: Great location especially when backpacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The street is nice and quiet. It was nice to have a balcony overlooking the street where we were able to get some takeaway ice cream and eat on the balcony.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great for backpackers as when travelling by train and wanting everything with in walking distance then this place I would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: a friendly atmosphere right in the heart of Sorrento

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great price and great staff.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location - good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic amenities and internet downstairs.
reviews.title: Terrific Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Excellent. Right on the main shopping/eating strip. Easy to walk to if you’re arriving by bus
reviews.title: Great location - would definitely recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms/amenities: our room and bathroom were small but nice, we had a balcony with patio furniture that we’d use each night, breakfast was average
reviews.title: A good hotel with a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Suggestions: can’t remember the name or exact location but there’s a take-out place in one of the side street/alley-ways that serves up fresh calzones and arancini (deep fried/stuffed rice balls), some of the best I’ve had, we also did a cheese factory tour/tasting that was fun that we’d recommend: http://www.caseificiomichelangelo.com
reviews.title: convenient, comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall: would definitely stay here again, front desk staff were very helpful, we stayed here when there was the explosion at Viareggio train station, and they called Trenitalia every day for us to ask the status since it affected us for the next leg of our journey
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location. The hotel re very simple, but it is perfect if you are not planning to spend much time at the hotel. The hotel is close to the port, the train station, and the center of town, so its convenient to anywhere you want to go.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you so much for a perfect stay! We really enjoyed staying at your nice, clean and very friendly hotel and we will be back, for sure! Perfectly situated and it felt like nothing was impossible to obtain. You really made us feel that whatever we asked for it was a pleasure for you to help out! Thanls to all of you for everything from cleaning our room, making us breakfast and serving us in diffent ways. Also, thank you for our little talks and my trial & error in speaking Italian. Grazie per tutto a voi tutti! Un piaccere tutta la semana. Ci vediamo!
reviews.title: Nice & friendly and yet 10 point service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to book into Sorrento City Hotel at a moments notice, had booked and been staying in new local apartment S/C. Returned to find rodents in it so had packed within 10 mins left and saw this hotel and checked in,If only we knew of this hotel first, spotless,comfy,fluffy clean towels,toiletries supplied and air con a must.the staff were very friendly and accommodating.Breakfast plentiful and a good variety.We had room 102, lush, 2 doors to balcony overlooking main street and square.Double glazing cut out any noise.Great to sit and people watch.Within 5mins stroll to bus/train station and 2-3 mins to main square.Great bakers/cake/icecream shop next dootr.Everything to die for and very reasonable.If I can persuade husband to return to Sorrento again will def book this hotel.Just cannot go wrong.
reviews.title: A GOD SEND

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The service at Hotel Sorrento City was comparable to that of a four or five star hotel in America for a lot less. All staff members are cordial and helpful. The room was great. It did not appear to have a lot of floor space when I walked in, but the way the room is designed allows for a lot more room than you think when you walk in. The hotel is located near the beach, resturaunts, and shops, which provide you with all you need during your stay here. They have a buffet breakfast included in the cost with a good selection of foods. Overall, if we come back to Sorrento, we will be booking our rooms at this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel for Anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and I stayed in this hotel in April 2010. It was an extremely pleasant stay. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the busy street below which was interesting to watch. Not noisy at all. Lots of great shops and restaurants nearby. Bus station around the corner for easy access to take day excursions along the coast. We absolutely loved our stay in Sorrento and will definitely choose this hotel when we visit again! Hopefully, in the near future! Loved this area of Italy!!!
reviews.title: Heart of the City Which Stole My Heart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fantastic location very close to main square, railway station and buses, all just a very short walk away.
reviews.title: Location, location,location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights in April. When making the initial booking, were advised that there was a problem with 1 night and we would be moved to another hotel. Before I could respond that we'd look for somewhere else, that was quickly fixed and we were told there was no problem with the booking for all 5 nights. However, when we arrived at reception we were told there was an issue with 1 night. In the end we didn't have to worry. We would have been quite upset if that had been the case.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After that little hiccup, our stay was a very pleasant one. The hotel is in a fantastic location - everything you'd need close by. The staff were very helpful. The balcony was the best part of the room. We loved sitting out there late afternoons and watching the world go by downstairs.
reviews.title: Great hotel, terrible service - got shafted to another hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Yes, we'd stay again.
reviews.title: Hotel right in the middle of town, so convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would advise you confirm, double confirm, and TRIPLE confirm your booking with this hotel if you decide to stay there. They have a reputation of deliberately overbooking (getting greedy) and then shafting travellers to other hotels that are further out, not as nice and - in our case - directly opposite a construction site!!!
reviews.title: Would return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After flying from Sydney - London - Naples and catching a train to Sorrento, we turned up to be told we were in Hotel Sorrento City's "Sister Hotel" down the road. Believing the receptionist, we dragged our bags across town in the rain to arrive at a tiny hotel opposite a construction site. Poor location, hotel window looked straight out at a wall, and room smelt like mold (there were no other guests there). Disappointed that the hotel we had booked and paid for online - ie, Hotel Sorrento - was not in fact where we ended up. We spoke to the receptionist in the **Sister** hotel who made it clear to us they were not in any way connected to Hotel Sorrento, and that Hotel Sorrento had just called her that afternoon to book us in.
reviews.title: Very friendly and helpful staff

description: A jewel in the heart of Sorrento, Sorrento City Hotel is a boutique hotel a short walk to Piazza Tasso: a living room to live the harmony of Sorrento Peninsula hospitality; a hotel, completely refurbished, which was the first Maison Meublè built in 50’s, where you can spend days of pure wonder. Style and elegance, prime quality of service and discretion make this hotel a symbol of Sorrento Peninsula hospitality.
